conclusion: Cars A and B are traveling in the same direction on a straight road.
The v-t graph shows two lines representing Cars A and B.
Car A has a horizontal line indicating constant velocity.
Car B has a diagonal line indicating increasing velocity.
Both lines intersect at \\( t = 20 \\) s and \\( v = 40 \\) m/s.
The intersection point indicates that both cars have the same velocity at \\( t = 20 \\) s.
The area under the line for Car A from \\( t = 0 \\) to \\( t = 10 \\) s is a rectangle.
The area under the line for Car B from \\( t = 0 \\) to \\( t = 10 \\) s is zero.
At \\( t = 10 \\) s, Car A's position is 400 meters and Car B's position is 0 meters.
Car A is ahead of Car B at \\( t = 10 \\) s.
